description.narrative: 6.2. By 2021, the criminal justice system has improved child-sensitive child justice practices at all stages., which contributes to Access To Justice, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Justice For Children, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 6. By 2021, children benefit from a system that ensures integrated, improved and equitable prevention of and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 6.2. By 2021, the criminal justice system has improved child-sensitive child justice practices at all stages.

description.narrative:
Despite delays, steady progress has been made with respect to harmonising the Children's Code with international standards, starting the development of the National Juvenile Justice Strategy, developing a road-map for Child Rights State Party Reporting, finalising the National Prosecutor's Handbook on Sexual Offences, initiating a Diversion Communication Strategy, mainstreaming juvenile justice into the National Social Welfare COVID-19 Prevention and Response Plan and strengthening partnerships with the Child Justice Forum, the Ministry of Community Development and Social Services and an NGO UpZambia to prioritise bail and diversion over detention.
| Status:Constrained | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Existence of specialized justice for children systems, such as capacity building and standards-setting within criminal and civil justice systems

baseline.value: Child related laws scattered in various statutes

target.value: 2021:Laws harmonised with International standards, Diversion legislated and age of criminal liability for children raised up from 7 to 14 years

actual.value: 2020:The bill has been undergoing re-drafting under the legal drafting department in the Ministry of Justice, incorporating inputs from MCDSS, Judiciary and partners before the actual stakeholders validation

title.narrative: Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms

baseline.value: No child justice strategy in line with international norms

target.value: 2021:Child justice interventions in line with National Child Justice Strategy, nationally and in selected districts

actual.value: 2020:The Judiciary took lead, the Terms of References for consultancy on the development of the National Strategy on child justice were developed and approved.

title.narrative: Percentage of justice professionals trained / certified in dealing with child offenders and child victims
